channel.title: Software Engineering on Greg Herlein
channel.description: Recent content in Software Engineering on Greg Herlein

item.title: What Would Grace Say?
item.description: Grace Hopper built the first compiler in 1952. They said “you can’t make them understand English-like instructions.” She had a running compiler and nobody would touch it. Sound familiar? Grace had some thoughts about this kind of thinking. She had a lot of thoughts, actually.

item.title: Coding is Solved (And That's Fine)
item.description: “We are nearly at coder-equivalency for economically useful coding. A sufficiently experienced software engineer can now write >90% of production-ready code purely through prompting.” Yes, exactly.

item.title: Guest Appearance: Women in STEM Podcast
item.description: I had a lot of fun being interviewed by Aimee Vincent-Bunn who hosts the fabulous Women in STEM podcast.

item.title: Guest Appearance: Software Synergy Podcast
item.description: I had a lot of fun being interviewed by James Holder for the Software Synergy Podcast. You can listen on Spotify or Apple.

item.title: September Update
item.description: Three months since I posted, so here’s some random thoughts and updates.

item.title: BrightSign!
item.description: What’s old is new again: I’ve joined BrightSign as their Head of Software Engineering!
